sentences.en: Cecile was in her early thirties, a sometime actress, dancer and singer.
sentences.cn: 塞茜尔三十出头，曾经做过演员、舞蹈演员和歌手。

sentences.en: Elvis conceived of himself as a ballad singer.
sentences.cn: 埃尔维斯认为自己是民谣歌手。

sentences.en: He got a job as a singer on a cruise ship.
sentences.cn: 他在一艘大型游轮上找了个歌手的差事。

sentences.en: Howard wanted to be a popular singer, but stage fright crippled him.
sentences.cn: 霍华德想成为流行歌手，但因怯场而心生畏惧。

sentences.en: I was the lead singer in the band that became the Prefects.
sentences.cn: 我曾是“级长”乐队前身的主唱。

sentences.en: She was seen in animated conversation with the singer Yuri Marusin.
sentences.cn: 有人看见她与歌手尤里·马鲁辛交谈甚欢。

sentences.en: Singer Brett Anderson inspires old-fashioned hero-worship.
sentences.cn: 歌手布雷特·安德森唤起了旧式的个人崇拜狂潮。
这个40岁的歌手重组了他的乐队。

sentences.en: the lead singer (= main singer ) of Slade
The lead singer was prancing around with the microphone.
sentences.cn: 首席歌手手执麦克风，神气地走来走去。

sentences.en: The publicity-shy singer spoke frankly in his first interview in three years.
sentences.cn: 这位不喜欢抛头露面的歌手在3年来的首次访谈中畅所欲言。

sentences.en: The singer earns a colossal amount of money.
sentences.cn: 那歌手现在可赚大钱了。

sentences.en: The singer gave a dismal performance of some old songs.
sentences.cn: 那歌手唱了几首老歌，唱得不怎么样。

phrases.tran_cn: n. 民歌手；民歌演唱者
